intro: Chaerophyllum basicola, commonly known as the European meadow cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Chaerophyllum basicola is a perennial herb that is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable conditions.
